easyread-text-10-0: A self-care manual is a book that helps you take care of yourself. It gives you ideas and tips to stay healthy and happy.
easyread-text-10-1: Simple rules to take care of yourself.
easyread-text-10-2: When we talk about self-care, we should think about some important things. Some people wrote about this and shared their ideas.
easyread-text-10-3: People can choose to take care of their own health. They do it themselves because they want to.
easyread-text-10-4: Everyone should look after their health every day. We need doctors and hospitals, but also support from family and friends.
easyread-text-10-5: People take care of themselves to stay healthy. They do things to protect themselves or stop getting sick because they believe it makes them healthier.
easyread-text-10-6: To take care of yourself, you need to grow inside. This means feeling good about yourself, staying in control, accepting who you are, and being strong when things are hard.

easyread-text-11-1: It's important to take care of yourself. This helps you feel good and stay healthy.
easyread-text-11-10: It is important to have rules that keep work and personal life separate. Some people decide not to answer work calls and messages after work hours. Others can't do this because of their job, but they find other ways. We should respect what different people need.
easyread-text-11-11: Taking care of yourself helps you do better work. If you know what you need and set limits, you can focus on the most important things.
easyread-text-11-12: The person learns to say no to less important things. They focus on goals that help them grow and stay healthy, so they can do their best.
easyread-text-11-13: When people focus, they do better at work and with family. It mostly helps the person who uses these habits in their life.
easyread-text-11-2: Doing things to take care of yourself helps you stay healthy and happy. It can stop you from getting sick and help you feel better if you are sick.
easyread-text-11-3: When we add these practices, people with long-term illnesses follow their treatment plans better.
easyread-text-11-4: This helps people get better and gives them more tools and power to handle their problems.

easyread-text-17-3: Here are some activities you can do:
easyread-text-17-4: Taking care of your body means eating healthy food, keeping clean, sleeping well, exercising, and looking after yourself if you feel sick.
easyread-text-17-5: Emotional self-care means understanding and accepting your feelings and other people's feelings too. Feelings are a normal part of life and do not make you who you are.
easyread-text-17-6: It's important to know we are not bad because of how we feel, but we are in charge of what we do because of those feelings.

easyread-text-17-8: Learn new skills that you like and think are fun.
easyread-text-17-9: Make good friends and have people who support you. This helps you stay healthy.

sectioneli5-0-0: This is a book that teaches us to take care of ourselves. Imagine it as a guide to feel good and happy. The image shows someone with a smile, and that means they are relaxed and taking good care of themselves. It's important to take care of oneself!
sectioneli5-10-0: Self-care is when you take care of yourself. Imagine taking care of a plant: you need to provide water, light, and attention. For people, taking care of oneself means doing things like eating well and resting. It's something you decide to do for yourself each day. It's also important to have friends and family who support you. Taking care of yourself strengthens important things like feeling good about yourself, being resilient, and loving yourself as you are.
sectioneli5-11-0: Self-care is like a superpower to be healthier and happier. If you take good care of yourself by doing things like resting, eating well, and doing what you enjoy, you can prevent getting sick or feeling sad. Moreover, if you're already sick, taking care of yourself helps you get better faster. It's like having more tools to feel better and stronger every day!
sectioneli5-11-1: Taking care of oneself is like learning more about what you like and what makes you happy. It helps you understand what your body and mind need to be well. It's like sending a message to yourself that says 'I am important.' This helps you feel good about yourself and gives you more confidence.
sectioneli5-11-2: Understanding oneself better and knowing what you need helps in making decisions and setting boundaries. For example, some people choose not to respond to work messages in their free time to separate work from their personal life. The important thing is to know what you need and take care of your well-being. This helps you feel better and be happier.
sectioneli5-11-3: When you take care of yourself and set boundaries on what you do, you can better concentrate on what is most important. This means saying 'no' to things that do not help you grow. This way, you feel better and work better on things that are important to you and to others.
sectioneli5-12-0: Self-care is like taking care of yourself. It not only helps you accomplish more things, but it also helps you get along better with others. This is because it teaches you to manage your emotions and solve problems. Imagine giving yourself a hug to feel better and happier.
sectioneli5-12-1: Self-care is more than doing random things to take care of oneself. It is about taking our health seriously and working on ourselves. This can take time, but it is important to feel better.
sectioneli5-13-0: Sometimes people think that taking care of oneself is selfish, but in reality, it is important in order to be able to care for others as well. sectioneli5-44-2: To have fun and be creative, you can do things like plan a party, play a sport, or go shopping. You can also go to the movies or cook with your friends. Going to the beach, eating at a restaurant, or singing karaoke are great ways to have a good time together.
sectioneli5-44-3: Here are some fun things you can do with your friends or family to relax and learn together. You can create a quiet place to relax, play board games, or even learn a new language. You could also talk about a book you read, learn to play a musical instrument, or go to the gym to exercise. They are great ways to have fun and spend time with other people!
sectioneli5-45-0: The text explains that spiritual care is important for feeling good and strong. It tells us that this is not the same as organized religion, such as going to church. Rather, it is something more general that helps us feel connected to the world and to ourselves.
sectioneli5-45-1: Spirituality is a topic that is sometimes forgotten when we think about taking care of ourselves, but it is very important because it can help us feel better and stronger. It is different from religiosity, which is related to following the rules of a church. Spirituality is more about how we connect with the world, nature, and ourselves. It's like tending to our inner garden to grow and feel at peace.
sectioneli5-46-0: Although not everyone believes in a religion, everyone can feel connected to something through spirituality, which helps us understand our emotions and purposes. Some activities anyone can do to feel better include meditating every day, attending religious or humanistic services, spending time in nature, keeping a gratitude journal, saying nice things about oneself, and traveling to take photos of things that inspire us.
sectioneli5-46-1: Here are some ways to feel happier and more connected with yourself. You can meditate every day, exercise to stay calm. You can also go to a special event, such as a religious or cultural one. Go out into nature and think about how beautiful it is. Write a journal thanking for all the good things you have. Say nice things about yourself to feel better. Finally, take a trip to take photos of things that inspire you. All of this helps you feel good and learn more about what you like.
sectioneli5-47-0: 'Practical exercises' means you are going to do activities to practice something. It's like when you practice sports or drawing: you do exercises to improve and learn more.
sectioneli5-48-0: This activity is like writing a magic letter to yourself. First, find a quiet place and close your eyes. Think about what you need to be happy and healthy, like eating well or playing with friends. Then, write those ideas in a letter. Remember that your needs can change over time, and it's okay to modify the letter when you need to.
sectioneli5-49-0: The text is a reminder to think about how we take care of ourselves. It asks what things we do now to take care of ourselves, like washing our hands or eating well. It also invites us to think about other things we could do to feel better, like exercising or getting enough rest.
sectioneli5-50-0: The "Self-Care Manual" is about how to take care of your feelings. It asks, "What do I do?" to feel good and "What else can I do to take care of myself?" It's like making a list of things that help you feel happy and calm. You can write things like playing, talking with friends, or meditating. It's important to think about how to take care of ourselves internally.
sectioneli5-50-1: Emotional self-care is about taking care of your feelings. Here, you think about things you already do to feel good and also other extra things you could do to take better care of yourself. It's like making a list of what makes you happy and calm!
sectioneli5-50-2: Taking care of yourself emotionally means thinking about how you can feel good inside. This can include doing things that make you happy, like drawing or playing. The questions here ask you to think about what you do to take care of yourself and what more you could do to feel even better. For example, you could go out to play or talk to your friends when you feel sad.
sectioneli5-51-0: This is an exercise to think about how to take care of yourself, especially when you're with other people. You should write about the things you already do to take care of yourself and also think about new ones you could try to feel good and happy.
sectioneli5-52-0: This is an exercise where you think about how you can take care of yourself internally, such as your emotions or thoughts. First, you write down what you already do to take care of yourself. Then, you think of more things you could do to feel good and happy.
sectioneli5-53-0: Self-care means taking care of yourself in different ways. There are many ways to do it, and each person can choose the one they like the most and makes them feel better. It's like choosing your favorite ice cream flavor; you decide which is best for you.
sectioneli5-58-0: This is a book that teaches us how to take better care of ourselves. Just as when you brush your teeth to keep them healthy, this manual tells you how to take care of yourself in all aspects, with the help of a group called Fundasil.
sectioneli5-6-0: Here is a list of topics from a book about self-care. Self-care means taking care of oneself. It talks about taking care of the body, emotions, thoughts, how you get along with others, and your spirit. It also provides exercises to practice and a list of books for further reading. It's like a guide to taking care of yourself every day.
sectioneli5-8-0: When we think about taking care of our health, we usually think about exercising, eating well, and visiting the doctor. But it is also very important to take care of our mind. Complete health means being well in body and mind. It is not just about not being sick. Taking care of health is something we all must do together.
sectioneli5-8-1: In this section, you will learn about the broad-snouted caiman, a reptile native to Uruguay that belongs to the crocodile family called Alligatoridae. You will observe how this animal’s physical characteristics, such as its skin color, allow it to camouflage in its natural environment; you will also discover how it builds its nests and cares for its young. In addition, you will reflect on the importance of protecting this species, as it faces threats, especially from humans who hunt it for its skin.
sectioneli5-9-0: Self-care is when we take care of ourselves to stay healthy and avoid getting sick. This means doing good things like eating well and resting. The image shows a person watering themselves, as if they were a plant, to grow strong and happy.
sectioneli5-9-1: Self-care means doing things that help keep us healthy and happy, like a superhero taking care of themselves. This includes eating well, exercising, and resting. Each person has different ways of caring for themselves based on what they like and what they've learned. The idea is that we are all responsible for taking care of our own wellbeing.
sectioneli5-9-2: Self-care means taking good care of yourself to be healthy and happy. To do this, you can eat well and exercise, but it's also very important to have good friends, understand how you feel, and rest when you need to. This way your body and mind feel better.

text-8-2: Generally, we associate exercising, eating a balanced diet, and visiting the primary care physician at least once a year as the main aspects of health care.
text-8-3: However, there is a vital aspect of our balance that we do not give the importance it deserves, and that is mental health.
text-8-4: According to the World Health Organization (WHO) (2004), a state of complete physical, mental, and social well-being goes beyond the absence of ailments or diseases.
text-8-5: For this reason, health care should not be limited to physical aspects, as it involves a more comprehensive view of well-being.
text-8-6: From this more complete and comprehensive perspective, a challenge arises: understanding that the various areas of health care are not confined to a specific institution, group, or individual. Integral health requires a shared responsibility among all parties.
text-8-7: The concept of self-care encompasses all those daily practices and decisions undertaken by an individual, group, or family to maintain their health and achieve a better quality of life (Correa, 2016).
text-8-8: To do this, create a mound with materials found on site. Therefore, establishing moments of self-care is essential, as it influences overall health and provides multiple benefits such as:
text-9-2: It is an approach to health in which the individual is responsible for undertaking individual and/or collective actions that can strengthen or restore overall well-being, as well as prevent illnesses.
text-9-3: In this regard, self-care requires the development of practices that, according to learned interests and skills, as well as the customary habits of the culture, promote survival and encourage taking responsibility for addressing what affects one's health.
text-9-4: The personal practices involved in self-care, although they vary among individuals, primarily aim at preserving health.
text-9-5: Therefore, indeed, maintaining a proper diet and engaging in healthy physical activities are part of the possible self-care practices, but it is also important to have good social relationships, learn to recognize and value one's own emotions, rest when necessary, among other personal care activities.
